text: Johannes Alberti, O.P. was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Auxiliary Bishop of Halberstadt (1550–?)."Bishop Johannes Alberti, O.P." Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved March 21, 2016"Diocese of Halberstadt" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Diocese of Halberstadt" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Johannes Alberti was ordained a priest in the Order of Preachers. On 27 Jun 1550, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Julius III as Auxiliary Bishop of Halberstadt and Titular Bishop of Tripolis in Phoenicia. It is uncertain how long he served. == See also == *Catholic Church in Germany == References == Category:16th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Julius III Category:Dominican bishops
title: Johannes Alberti (bishop)
